timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@

+package com.yahoo.elide.spring.security;
+
+import com.yahoo.elide.security.User;
+import org.springframework.security.core.Authentication;
+import org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority;
+
+/**
+ * Elide User object for Spring Boot.

timeline.bodyText: How (if at all) will the Role class here relate to https://docs.spring.io/spring-security/site/docs/4.2.12.RELEASE/apidocs/org/springframework/security/core/GrantedAuthority.html in https://docs.spring.io/spring-security/site/docs/4.2.12.RELEASE/apidocs/org/springframework/security/core/Authentication.html for the spring security use case?
timeline.author: codingwhatever

replies.bodyText: GrantedAuthority can be mapped to a string.  You would pass in the string representation of the GrantedAuthority in that case.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Are there any known use cases that would not be supported by Principal?
timeline.author: codingwhatever

replies.bodyText: Not that I can think of.  Spring maps everything down to a subclass of Principal. JAXRS has both the SecurityContext and the Principal.  Where we have used JAXRS - we tend to put all the user bits into a subclass of Principal.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.message: All test pass except for spring

timeline.bodyText: @aklish Is this all that is left in RequestScope?
timeline.author: wcekan
wcekan

replies.bodyText: Elide deals with User directly so it can provide common checks (like role checks out of the box).
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText:
@aklish We used this for hydrating the opaqueUser bean in the context of the current Hibernate transaction.
How will lifecycle work then without this?  The transaction is not created by us when we call Elide.
